comments: Number of ways to have center of gravity of an n-dimensional hypercube at center by weighting each vertex with 0 or 1.
references: E. M. Palmer, R. C. Read and R. W. Robinson, Balancing the n-cube: a census of colorings, J. Algebraic Combin., 1 (1992), 257-273.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
example: For a square (2 dimensions) there are 4 ways to weight each vertex with 0 or 1 while retaining center of gravity at center of the square, so a(2)=4.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
